articles.content:
Syrian PM Supports Revolutionary Cause of Korean People 
    Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Syrian Prime Minister Muhammad Nazi Otri, when he met new DPRK ambassador Kim Pyong Nam on a courtesy call on April 6, said he warmly supported and highly appreciated the just cause of the fraternal Korean people, noting that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries were developing continuously on good terms under the deep concern of the leaders of the two countries.
 He said Kim Jong Il was wisely leading the struggle of the Korean people against imperialism and for the building of a great prosperous powerful socialist nation.    
 Syria will in the future, too, make every possible effort to further develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK, he declared.

articles.title: U.S. Vice-President's Planned Seoul Visit Denounced
articles.content:
Huge Mosaic Erected 
    Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- A huge mosaic "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Always Be with Us" was erected in Nampho.
 It is 11.5 meters wide and 10.5 meters high. It represents the tender image of Kim Il Sung, the peerlessly great man and the father of socialist Korea with a sunny smile, who accomplished the historical cause of national liberation, built the powerful socialist state of Juche on this land and glorified all over the world the dignity and honor of the country and the nation with his brilliant wisdom and distinguished leadership ability and noble idea of believing in people as in Heaven.    
 The unveiling ceremony of the mosaic was held on the spot Sunday.

articles.title: Written Request Handed to Secretary General of JSDP
articles.content:
U.S. Vice-President's Planned Seoul Visit Denounced 
    Pyongyang, April 12 (KCNA) -- Students of the Seoul District Federation of University Student Councils of south Korea reportedly conducted street propaganda in protest against U.S. Vice-President Cheney's planned Seoul visit at the intersection in front of Myongdong, Seoul, on April 7.
 They disclosed that the purpose of Cheney's Seoul junket slated for April 15 is to invariably force the additional troop dispatch to Iraq upon south Korea.    
 They declared that they would wage a more vigorous struggle against the troop dispatch, while exposing the injustice of the troop dispatch in solidarity with civic organizations.

articles.title: U.S. Dangerous Attempt to Launch Nuclear War Denounced
articles.content:
Written Request Handed to Secretary General of JSDP 
    Tokyo, April 10 (KNS-KCNA) -- Han Jong Chi, director of the International Affairs and Reunification Department of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), met with Seiji Mataichi, secretary general of the Japan Social-Democratic Party, on April 6 and handed to him a written request of Chongryon in which it opposed the passage of the "bill banning the portcalls of specified foreign ships" through the Diet.
 He requested the Japan Social-Democratic Party to prudently approach the move to enact an evil law aimed at blocking the sea route for humanitarian visits of Koreans in Japan to their homeland and barring even the non-governmental exchange between the two countries.    
 The secretary general said that his party would oppose the passage of the "bill" threatening the life of Koreans in Japan, noting that the "bill" is a dangerous one as it is quite contrary to the spirit of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration. The party will in the future, too, strengthen the cooperation and solidarity with Chongryon, he said.
